episode_summary: This episode explores the origins and usage of the word 'wow' in Scotland, the diverse ecosystems found in elephant footprints, the history of Wisden's Cricketer's Almanac, and the fascinating world of fossilized excrement known as coprolites.

facts.fact: The word "wow" was popular in Scotland for 400 years before it caught on in the rest of the English-speaking world.
At least 61 species live in elephant footprints.
The original edition of Wisden's Cricketer's Almanac was 112 pages long and because the author wasn't sure what to put in it, was padded out with accounts of the trial of King Charles I.
The largest known fossilized human turd is 20 centimeters long and 5 centimeters wide, and it was made by a Viking.
